revised_title: Magnetic Properties of Haemoglobin Complexes: Structures and Ionization Potentials
tldr: The authors investigate the magnetic properties of haemoglobin complexes and propose two possible structures, A and B, for the interaction between the iron atom and oxygen molecules. They also calculate ionization potentials for these structures, finding that the electrons in structure B are more accessible and likely to be involved in coordination. This study provides insights into the magnetic behavior and oxygen binding of haemoglobin complexes.
